channel.title: This Site Makes Me Want to Cry :(

item.title: SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.
item.description:
SumoMe, free tools to grow your website traffic.

Feb 1st, 2016 by Sarah Peterson It's your biggest frustration. The thing that keeps you up at night. That makes you want to bang your head against the wall over, and over, and over... Not enough traffic. You can learn every conversion technique in the world but it will all be pointless if you have nobody to convert.

item.title: Steve Jobs Was a Low-Tech Parent
item.description:
Steve Jobs Was a Low-Tech Parent

When Steve Jobs was running Apple, he was known to call journalists to either pat them on the back for a recent article or, more often than not, explain how they got it wrong. I was on the receiving end of a few of those calls.

item.title: 6 Questions to Ask for Powerful Testimonials
item.description:
6 Questions to Ask for Powerful Testimonials

This is the second and final installment of The Secret Life of Testimonials. Most of us ask for testimonials. And if we follow up and pester our customers enough, we get testimonials. There's only one problem. Our testimonials have no power. Testimonials are stories. And stories have power and grace, flow and rhythm.

item.title: The Power of Broke: Q&A With Shark Tank's Daymond John - Foundr
item.description:
The Power of Broke: Q&A With Shark Tank's Daymond John - Foundr

Want the heads up when new stories drop? Subscribe Here It's extremely rare for a powerhouse business to find financial success right out of the gate. Sure there are people who have inherited successful businesses or have wealthy backers, but if you look back far enough, you'll find that most business success stories started off with a scrappy startup founder.
